title: ‘Your Countries Are Going to Hell’: Trump Airs His Grievances at the U.N.
summary: In a meandering address, President Trump rebuked global institutions and complained about immigration, environmentalists, windmills and more.

title: Cache of Devices Capable of Crashing Cell Network Is Found Near U.N.
summary: The Secret Service discovered more than 100,000 SIM cards and 300 servers, which could disable cellular towers or be used to conduct surveillance.

title: In Israel, Government Backlash Brews Over Palestinian State Recognition
summary: As more countries moved to formally recognize a Palestinian state, a far-right member of Israel’s government called for “countermeasures” including the annexation of the West Bank.

title: ABC Affiliate Owners Boycott Jimmy Kimmel’s Return to Late Night
summary: Together, the two TV station groups, Sinclair and Nexstar, control more than 20 percent of ABC’s local affiliates.

title: What Will Jimmy Kimmel Say Tonight?
summary: The return of the late-night host’s show raises questions about how the Trump administration, TV affiliate owners and viewers might react.

title: Trump’s Remarks at Kirk Memorial Distill His Politics: ‘I Hate My Opponent’
summary: President Trump has been fueled by grievance and animosity over the course of his political and public life.

title: Trump Cancels Meeting With Democrats as Government Shutdown Nears
summary: Top Democrats are demanding concessions on health care in exchange for their support on a bill to fund the government. Mr. Trump called the demands “unserious.”

title: Powell Stresses ‘Challenging Situation’ for Fed as Rate Debate Intensifies
summary: Rising inflation and a weakening labor market have created a bind for the central bank, Jerome H. Powell, its chair, warned on Tuesday.

title: Elon Musk’s Father, Errol Musk, Accused of Child Sexual Abuse
summary: Errol Musk has been accused of sexually abusing five of his children and stepchildren since 1993, a Times investigation found. Family members have appealed to Elon Musk for help.

title: Sushi Is Bigger Than Ever in America. Here’s Why.
summary: Once considered rarefied and exotic in the United States, sushi has become something entirely different in the last five years: convenience food.

title: People With Autism React to Trump’s Message on Tylenol
summary: Some welcomed more research and possible new treatments. But the administration’s embrace of unproven science and depiction of autism as a “crisis” has sown deep mistrust.

title: What to Know About Tylenol, Pregnancy and Babies
summary: President Trump said on Monday that Tylenol use during pregnancy could lead to autism, a claim that is unproven.

title: Hepatitis B Vaccine, Once a Public Health Win, Is Under Threat From RFK Jr.
summary: Rates of the disease have fallen since 1991, when all newborns began receiving the shot. President Trump recently said he thought children should not get it until age 12.

title: Zackery Nazario Died Subway Surfing. Is Social Media to Blame?
summary: Norma Nazario didn’t understand what had motivated her 15-year-old son to subway surf. Then she found his phone.

title: Why African Countries Keep Making Deals to Accept U.S. Deportees
summary: As the Trump administration exerts pressure on countries to aid in its mass deportation efforts, some nations in Africa have agreed, prompting legal battles.

title: Trump’s $100,000 H-1B Visa Fee Puts Many Tech Start-Ups in a Bind
summary: Silicon Valley start-ups said they were concerned they would be disproportionately hurt by the new visa fee for skilled foreign workers, given their limited resources.

title: To Understand Ukraine at War, Stop by a Gas Station
summary: Filling stations have become must-stop spots for soldiers traveling to and from the front, helping them win a place in Ukrainians’ hearts.

title: Trump’s Pick to Replace Ousted U.S. Attorney Lacks Prosecutorial Experience
summary: Lindsey Halligan worked as a personal lawyer for President Trump and then led the effort to scrutinize the Smithsonian for “improper ideology.”

title: TikTok Deal Could Make Oracle Founder Larry Ellison a New Kind of Media Mogul
summary: The database billionaire and his son, David, are Trump favorites. The family could soon control an empire that includes CBS, Paramount, Warner, CNN and a piece of TikTok.

title: Judge in Gilgo Beach Case Spurns Request to Throw Out DNA Evidence
summary: Lawyers for Rex Heuermann, who is charged with killing seven women, made last-ditch attempts to toss crucial evidence, but prosecutors are preparing for an expected trial next year.

title: 4 Autism Experts React to Trump’s Plan
summary: This is not what autistic people need, experts say.

title: The Trump Vengeance Tour Is Coming to a Stadium Near You
summary: The MAGA movement’s encirclement maneuver is gaining ground.

title: A Fact-Check on Trump’s Claims About Tylenol, Vaccines and Autism
summary: How President Trump ignored science about vaccines in his news conference.

title: Jury to Decide Fate of Ryan Routh, Man Accused of Trying to Assassinate Trump
summary: The man accused of lying in wait with a rifle at a Florida golf course in 2024 mounted his own defense in a 12-day trial.

title: N.Y.P.D. Misconduct Complaints Surged Under Adams, Report Says
summary: The number of misconduct reports to a watchdog agency increased 60 percent under Mayor Eric Adams and last year were the highest in a decade, according to a city report.

title: The Rapture Was Predicted to Happen Today. TikTok Has Some Advice.
summary: There are thousands of videos to help prepare those who may or may not ascend into the heavens on Tuesday.

title: Saudi Grand Mufti, an Archconservative in a Changing Kingdom, Dies
summary: The death of Abdulaziz Al Asheikh, Saudi Arabia’s most senior cleric, was the symbolic end of an era as the kingdom transforms.
